nodes.bodyText: Better use a try with resources IMHO.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -209,9 +209,12 @@ List<String> namesButEmmanuels = persons
     .map(p -> p.name.toLowerCase() )
     .filter( n -> ! "emmanuel".equals(n) )
     .collect(Collectors.toList());
+persons.close(); // close the stream to release I/O resources

nodes.bodyText: Yes,  I agree,  was too lazy to refactor the code ... will do it tomorrow

nodes.bodyText: Can you add backticks around the two ResultSet occurrences?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -209,9 +209,12 @@ List<String> namesButEmmanuels = persons
     .map(p -> p.name.toLowerCase() )
     .filter( n -> ! "emmanuel".equals(n) )
     .collect(Collectors.toList());
+persons.close(); // close the stream to release I/O resources
 ----
 
-NOTE: The `stream` methods require a transaction to work.
+NOTE: The `stream` methods require a transaction to work. +
+As they perform I/O operations, they should be closed via the `close()` method or via a try-with-resource to close the underlying ResultSet.
+If not, you will see warnings from Agroal that will close the underlying ResultSet for you.
